The BigFish card game is for everyone interested in fun card games, fishing or marine life.

To win the game you must find the best fishing strategy to collect points from catching fish, while keeping your fishing spot healthy and protected from natural disasters and other players.

## Crowdfunding! {style="color: var(--bs-accent);"}
:::

Get your own copy of the game and support education on sustainable fishing and marine life. 

All proceeds from the crowdfunding campaign will go for outreach activities and developing the game further. We will aim to have the game available in shops, but this is not certain. Which means that **crowdfunding** is the best way to secure your own copy of the game and other great rewards. 

The campaign will launch on **September 15, 2024**.

## Playing the game

<!-- start flush grid -->
:::::::::::: {.grid .column-screen-nogap .justify-contents-evenly .align-items-center .my-3}
<!-- text column -->
::::::::: {.order-1 .g-col-12 .g-col-sm-12 .g-col-md-12 .g-col-lg-8 .g-col-xl-8 .g-col-xxl-8 .mx-2 .mx-lg-3 .mx-xl-4 .mx-xxl-5}

<!-- text section grid -->
:::::: {.grid .justify-contents-evenly .align-items-center}
<!-- mini-image column -->
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-sm-4 .g-col-md-4 .g-col-lg-4 .mx-5 .mx-sm-1 .text-center .img-container}
![](resources/images/cooler-no-text.jpg){width="80%"}
:::

<!-- text-step column -->
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-sm-8 .g-col-md-8 .g-col-lg-8 .mx-2 .mx-lg-3 .mx-xl-4 .mx-xxl-5 .img-container}
Big fish are worth more points than small fish, so players want to catch them. But the presence of big fish also allows players to draw new cards, spawn new fish and also grow them. The player has to find a balance between collecting points by catching fish and preserving big fish for good fishing opportunities in the future. 
:::

<!-- mini-image column -->
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-sm-4 .g-col-md-4 .g-col-lg-4 .mx-5 .mx-sm-1 .text-center .img-container}
![](resources/images/cards/wild-cards/illegal-fishing.jpg){.image-card width="80%"}
:::

<!-- text-step column -->
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-sm-8 .g-col-md-8 .g-col-lg-8 .mx-2 .mx-lg-3 .mx-xl-4 .mx-xxl-5 .img-container}
In addition to fishing, other natural and human-induced events occur throughout the game: fisheries research, poor water quality, citizen science, illegal fishing, ocean acidification, sea urchin arrival and others.
:::

<!-- mini-image column -->
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-sm-4 .g-col-md-4 .g-col-lg-4 .mx-5 .mx-sm-1 .text-center .img-container}
![](resources/images/Bigfish-logo.png){width="80%"}
:::

<!-- text-step column -->
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-sm-8 .g-col-md-8 .g-col-lg-8 .mx-2 .mx-lg-3 .mx-xl-4 .mx-xxl-5 .img-container}
These events create unpredictability and new challenges. Players can partly protect their fishing spots by finding the best game strategy. 
:::

## Main messages 

<!-- messages text grid -->
::::::::::: {.grid .column-screen-padded .text-center .spacer-3em style="--bs-columns: 1;"}
<!-- To win the game you need a good strategy and luck. There is always an element of chance, but a good fisher and player knows how to get their luck. In this game you need to think about the long term strategy! The game has three main messages: -->

We developed the game because we love fun card games and we love the ocean. We also love big fish. 
:::::::::::

<!-- start flush grid -->
:::::::::::: {.grid .column-screen-nogap .justify-contents-evenly .align-items-center .my-3}
<!-- text column -->
::::::::: {.order-2 .g-col-12 .g-col-sm-12 .g-col-md-12 .g-col-lg-8 .g-col-xl-8 .g-col-xxl-8 .mx-2 .mx-lg-3 .mx-xl-4 .mx-xxl-5}
### 1. Big fish are important

Preserving the big fish in the oceans, lakes and rivers is important for fish reproduction and resilience, ecosystem balance, for the fun of fishing, or simply because big fish are beautiful.

### 2. Big fish are mostly gone

Due to commercial and recreational fishing, big fish have mostly vanished from oceans, rivers and lakes.

### 3. Big fish can return

Fish grow relatively fast and if we take the right actions, we can restore them within our lifetimes and enjoy their beauty and benefits again.

## Who we are {#sec-about style="margin-top: 0.5em;"}

This game has been developed by the Institute of Marine and Antarctic Sciences, University of Tasmania team, led by Matt Testoni, Asta Audzijonyte and Amy Coghlan. All artwork is original and produced by Amy Coghlan (drawings), Matt Testoni (photos, design) and Stacey McCormack (design).

Game testing, advice, interesting facts and many other details have been provided by many researchers, naturalists, students, friends, anglers, divers and game enthusiasts. Thank you.
